Major_Arcs.title: Introduction and Ghost Town Mystery
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting, main characters, and the central mystery surrounding Ghost Town, along with initial romantic undertones.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon and Ghost Town Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the main character in a saloon setting and hints at the mystery of Ghost Town through contrasting conversations.

Major_Arcs.title: Conflict over Ghost Town and Romantic Tensions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc develops the conflict around the destruction of Ghost Town and introduces romantic tensions and contrasting perspectives on romance and practicality.

sub_scenes.title: Modern Day Conflict and Romantic Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene reveals the plan to build an airport on Ghost Town and explores the clash between romantic ideals and practical considerations.

narrative_arcs.title: Modern Day Disruption: Airport Plans for Ghost Town
Encounter with Construction Workers and Disdain

sub_scenes.title: Family Drama and Nan's Pursuit of Cal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on family dynamics, Nan's emotional turmoil, and her decision to pursue Cal, intertwined with the practicalities of ranch life.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses to the Airport and the Deal

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Emotional Encounter
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's emotional confession to Cal, his initial distance, and their eventual intimate moment.

sub_scenes.title: Winter Crisis and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene portrays the community facing a severe winter storm, dealing with livestock concerns, and finding unexpected relief.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollections of Changed Weather and Difficult Journey
Seeking Comfort and Reassurance Amidst Hardship
Recalling Past Winter's Severity and Impending Starvation
Riding Out to Face the Crisis and Uncertain Future
Reflection on Restlessness and Persistent Snowfall
The Sound of Hope: Arrival of a Plane
Relief from the Sky and Reflections on Romance

Major_Arcs.title: The Saga of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces and develops the storyline of Chane Benson, exploring themes of heroism, violence, and journalistic integrity.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and Initial Reactions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic entrance and sets up initial opinions and discussions about his character.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Fascination and Sally's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Jeff's admiration for Chane Benson and Sally's worries about Jeff's behavior and the influence of violent figures.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice on Decency and Confrontation with Benson

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and Benson's Ominous Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene intensifies Sally's worry about Jeff, leads to her seeking help from Clyde, and introduces Mr. Benson with an ominous tone.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern Over Jeff's Gun Obsession and Control
Reassurance and Premonition of Finding Jeff
Clyde's Retrospective Account of Jeff's Disappearance
Introducing Mr. Benson and Casual Banter
Mr. Benson's Ominous Tone Shift and Mention of Death

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Escalating Tension
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene revolves around the controversial article written by Clyde about Benson, leading to confrontations and escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Justification for Writing About Benson
Sally's Distrust and Ominous Description of Benson
Benson's Threat to Clean Up Juniper Town

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Tense Dinner Party
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the events leading up to and during the dinner party with Chane Benson, filled with suspicion and underlying tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Flashback to Benson's Articles and Consequences
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Sally's Persuasion and Jeff's Agreement to Invite Chane
Invitation to Dinner and Observation of Chane's Demeanor
Discussion on Chane's Artistic Skills and Character
Chane's Confrontation and Accusation of Trap
Sally's Accusation and Demand for Honesty
Sally's Angry Explanation to Jeff about Chane's Actions and Intentions

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Newspaper Office Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene culminates in the physical confrontation between Jeff and Chane, the chase, and the resolution at the newspaper office.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Angry Confrontation and Jeff's Punch
Sally's Desperate Plea and Jeff's Fall
Urgent Warning and Chase After Chane

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve: Range War and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escalating range war and the developing romance between Betsy and Steve amidst the conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Introduction and Range War Setup
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Betsy and Steve, sets up the ranch setting, and establishes the looming threat of a range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation and Approbation of Steve Daley's Hiring
Offer of Accommodation and Lingering Doubts

sub_scenes.title: Journey to Town and Store Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's journey to town, her developing feelings for Steve, and a dangerous confrontation outside the store.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Orders and Material for a Dress

sub_scenes.title: Decision to Hire Gunslinger and Romantic Confessions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Betsy's firm decision to hire a gunslinger, gaining approval, and the burgeoning romance between Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Firm Decision to Hire a Gunslinger
Justification and Acceptance from Authority Figure
Hank's Concern and Betsy's Softened Stance
Sudden Intense Feelings and Mutual Confession

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the climax at Devil's Pass, the resolution of the range war conflict, and the romantic culmination for Betsy and Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Arrival and Ranch Hands' Confrontation
Betsy's Warning and Steve's Determination Amidst Threats
Betsy's Assertion of Authority on Gun Use
Aftermath: Horse Theft and Realization of Loss
Ride to Devil's Pass and Arrival at Gunfire Scene
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave: Love Triangle and Business Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers on the love triangle between Carrie, Fred, and Dave, intertwined with business negotiations and personal sacrifices.

sub_scenes.title: Rancher's Daughter and Fence Dispute
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Carrie and Dave, setting up their relationship dynamics and a ranch dispute involving fences and Fred Gordon.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Concerns about Curley and Outsiders

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Conflicted Feelings
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the complex relationships between Carrie, Dave, and Fred, including apologies, conflicted feelings, and a romantic proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Business Deal and Carrie's Choice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the business contract and Carrie's emotional turmoil and ultimate romantic decision.

narrative_arcs.title: Assertion of Independence and Business Acumen
Father's Intuition and Long Ride Reflection
Revelation of Fred's Arrival and Misunderstanding
Carlton's Explanation of the Beef Contract
Affectionate Embrace and Plea for Kiss

sub_scenes.title: Dirk, Chris, and Rance: Law, Love, and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This final major arc resolves the Dirk, Chris, and Rance storyline, exploring themes of law, loyalty, and love in the Western setting.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Dirk's Injury and Medical Examination
Ranch Confrontation and Demand for Authority
Law vs. Justice and Dirk's Injury
Plea for Understanding and Escape Plan
Leaving the Wounded Marshal and Woman's Reflection
Dirk's Farewell and Escape to Mexico
Chris's Return to Rance and Woman's Thoughts
Rance's Pursuit and Dirk's Escape Confirmed
Clearing Chris's Name and Woman's Forgiveness
Confession of Love and Lingering Fear
Confrontation and Clarification at the Wedding
